level.text: In accordance with the provisions of this chapter, any person or entity eligible under § 300.2 may request an advisory opinion from the Board, with respect to any specific transaction or activity, as to whether the transaction or activity would constitute a violation of any provision of the Campaign Finance Act or the Election Act.
Any of the following shall be eligible to request an advisory opinion of the Board:
An individual holding public office in the District of Columbia;
A candidate for nomination for election;
A candidate for election to public office in the District of Columbia;
A person who may be a potential registrant under the Campaign Finance Act; or
A political committee as defined by the Campaign Finance Act.

level.heading: AUTHORITY
level.text: Unless otherwise noted, the authority for this chapter is section 306 of the District of Columbia Campaign Finance Reform and Conflict of Interest Act, P.L. No.93-376, D.C. Code §§ 1-1103.01(a) and 1-1103.02(a) (2006 Repl.).

level.heading: SOURCE
level.text: Final Rulemaking published at 28 D.C. Reg. 2153 (May 15, 1981).
